key_risks: Supply chain vulnerabilities due to reliance on suppliers like TSMC and GlobalFoundries
Geopolitical and regulatory risks, particularly in China
Competitive pressures from companies like Texas Instruments and Infineon
controversies: Criticism from labor unions and community organizations over worker conditions
Potential regulatory scrutiny due to environmental concerns
environmental_issues: Energy-intensive semiconductor manufacturing and significant waste generation
Commitment to net-zero emissions by 2050, but current environmental impact remains high
social_issues: Demands for living wages and safer working conditions
governance_issues: Regulatory changes impacting operations and profitability
Uncertainties in forward-looking statements regarding liquidity and capital needs

sources.title: Gender Discrimination Case Against Analog Devices Goes to Trial
sources.snippet: Donna Thornton was a medical SaaS sales specialist at Analog Devices Inc., and was part of the medical products business unit under managing director Venu Gopinathan. Thornton alleged that when she was hired, she was told her title may be reviewed but not her pay, because it was the only sales position open and was constrained by a set budget.

sources.title: Analog Devices Settles in Ex-Employee's Gender Disparity Lawsuit
sources.snippet: Analog Devices Inc. has settled with a former sales specialist who said a manager discriminated against her and the company retaliated against her for reporting it. After less than a month working with the male manager, he put specialist Donna Thornton on an unwarranted performance improvement plan with the goal of finding some pretext to fire her, she said.
